pullrequest.title: Added tutorial for contributing a model

content.raw: Looks like a good short tutorial, but we already have a similar tutorials at http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=build_model&cat=build_robot http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=build_robot&cat=build_robot. Perhaps we should give those tutorials more general titles ("building a model" instead of "building a robot").
content.html: Looks like a good short tutorial, but we already have a similar tutorials at http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=build_model&cat=build_robot http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=build_robot&cat=build_robot. Perhaps we should give those tutorials more general titles ("building a model" instead of "building a robot").

content.raw: Ok, John asked us for help with writing this. Perhaps he had an idea about how to merge the tutorials together (the tutorial you linked to does not cover the information in this one).
content.html: Ok, John asked us for help with writing this. Perhaps he had an idea about how to merge the tutorials together (the tutorial you linked to does not cover the information in this one).

pullrequest.title: Added tutorial for contributing a model

content.raw:
thanks @jacquelinekay for the links.

With thepropshop still under development, the motivation here was that it wasn't immediately clear to me which tutorial is the one to reference when someone wants to contribute a model to the [gazebo models database](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/src). Hence I asked Evan to document his experience.

The two existing tutorials:

 1. [Make a model tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=build_model&cat=build_robot) talks about details of a _SDF Model Object_, and should probably be updated that way (see 26df731).
 1. [Make a Mobile Robot tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=build_robot&cat=build_robot) touches on what a _Gazebo Model Object_ is (i.e. a directory containing SDF model, config file and resources).  Then it proceeds to talk about details of making a mobile robot _Gazebo Model_.

I feel the topic of what a _Gazebo Model_ is deserves its own tutorial, and perhaps we can extract the information describing what the _Gazebo Model Object_ is from [Make a Mobile Robot tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=build_robot&cat=build_robot) and merge it with this tutorial.  This tutorial can then refer back to the _Make a Mobile Robot_ tutorial to introduce users on how to make a more complex mobile robot?

My comments:

 * add a comment about pull requesting [gazebo_models](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests) if author wants the new model included in the aggregate model database, and
 * title this tutorial: _How to Contribute to Gazebo Models Database_

Thoughts?

Thanks.
content.html:
thanks @jacquelinekay for the links.

With thepropshop still under development, the motivation here was that it wasn't immediately clear to me which tutorial is the one to reference when someone wants to contribute a model to the gazebo models database. Hence I asked Evan to document his experience.

The two existing tutorials:

  1. Make a model tutorial talks about details of a SDF Model Object, and should probably be updated that way (see 26df731).
  2. Make a Mobile Robot tutorial touches on what a Gazebo Model Object is (i.e. a directory containing SDF model, config file and resources). Then it proceeds to talk about details of making a mobile robot Gazebo Model.

I feel the topic of what a Gazebo Model is deserves its own tutorial, and perhaps we can extract the information describing what the Gazebo Model Object is from Make a Mobile Robot tutorial and merge it with this tutorial. This tutorial can then refer back to the Make a Mobile Robot tutorial to introduce users on how to make a more complex mobile robot?

My comments:

  • add a comment about pull requesting gazebo_models if author wants the new model included in the aggregate model database, and
  • title this tutorial: How to Contribute to Gazebo Models Database

Thoughts?

Thanks.

pullrequest.title: Added tutorial for contributing a model

content.raw:
@nkoenig @scpeters is there a trick to visualize a tutorial in a remote branch?  e.g. for example:

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=drcsim_multisense&cat=drcsim&branch=drcsim_multisense_4.1

thanks,
John

thanks, John

pullrequest.title: Added tutorial for contributing a model

content.raw: You can download the `gazebo_tutorials`, install the gazebo web app, run the rails application, and use the `&repo=<path_to_gazebo_tutorials>`
content.html: You can download the gazebo_tutorials, install the gazebo web app, run the rails application, and use the &repo=<path_to_gazebo_tutorials>
